tweets.text: We have issued a flood warning for the River Lynher in #Cornwall from Berriowbridge to Notter Bridge. Heavy rain in the area has caused river levels at Bastreet and Pillaton to rise rapidly and further rain is forecast. https://t.co/gC4fEyQc8p https://t.co/XJzYFuu04o
We have issued a flood warning for the River Dart from Buckfastleigh to Totnes, including Staverton #Devon https://t.co/oamBdxjtoP https://t.co/JyjzIitrv9

A flood warning has been issued for River Teign (lower) from Chudleigh to Kingsteignton, including New Bridge, Ventiford, Preston, Teigngrace, Teign Bridge and Exeter Road #Devon https://t.co/K0E7OUFIx6 https://t.co/4Jw6SKSZYy
And just when you think things can‚Äôt get any worse....when will the flood defence be going up @EnvAgencySW @ExeterCouncil? https://t.co/gaGjnYxXqQ

Allermoor Spillway stopped running early this morning, we had teams out first thing opening Monksleaze to operate the SOWY FRC at maximum capacity, this allows us to commence pumping at Langport stations until spillways start to run again. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/IhBXnHPOu1

Flooding can happen at any time.
 
This festive period, check out four things you can do to protect yourself, your family, and your home.
 
 üëâhttps://t.co/PzDbHFZ82f
 
 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/2FDmubSMLz

@mrfly @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency @thameswater @LDNWaterkeeper If you scroll down on this link you'll see a long list of reasons as to why, in the EA's opinion, that section of the Lee is failing to make 'Good' overall environmental health. It makes for grim reading.

https://t.co/ErPUO30qmr

Flood Warning now in force: River Seaton from the A38 to Seaton #Devon. Flooding is expected for River Seaton from the A38 to Seaton, including Hessenford, Jopes Mill, the A387 and the A38.    https://t.co/2t11bRy5Ye #floodaware https://t.co/RcXURYldEF

Flood Warning now in force for: River Plym from Shaugh Bridge to Riverside Caravan Park, including Shaugh Bridge Car Park, Shaugh Mill and Longbridge Road #Devon    https://t.co/LVJraelEaW https://t.co/ti5EJZJbDg
Heavy rain across the South West is expected to impact some roads. Take care and never drive through flood water. https://t.co/XoURKx3zxw

The Met office have issued an amber warning for rain. We have issued flood alerts across the South West and are expecting to have to issue some flood warnings this afternoon. Please keep an eye on our flood warnings and know what to do in a flood https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15

We're expecting heavy & persistent rainfall in the region tonight & over the weekend which could bring a risk of #flooding in some communities.

tweets.text: @xrunnerwill @EnvAgencySW Well done everyone. Great to see the importance of real data gathering still being recognised and undertaken by expert EA Hydrometry teams.

It's a wet afternoon with amber and yellow rain warnings in place. 
There is a risk of isolated flooding especially in the South West 

Check our website for details
https://t.co/50AO3FYqGo

Stay #WeatherAware https://t.co/UNN5WShGCo

The dramatic opening lines of the Press Conference given by Sir Edward Hardy, (formerly @KCCChair,) & spokesmen from the #Kent River Board, in the aftermath of the catastrophic 1953 North Sea flood:
https://t.co/0ZbvpsgI7k

https://t.co/XHwq0qmo30

#HBAHCommunication @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/8HWaLHK89D

@MarkBowersEA @EnvAgencyMids I‚Äôm heading in to town after school pick up today, I will avoid parking in Frankwell as I‚Äôd planned. If you could do your best to keep rivers within banks as I‚Äôm back on duty Monday, that would be nice üòÅ

The #BostonBarrier is the first @EnvAgency project which retrospectively looked at @GlobalGoalsUN. We can evidence achievements against all 17 #GlobalGoals & this work is now used as a benchmark within the EA for all future major projects.

üìΩÔ∏èWatch as @johncurtinEA explains more: https://t.co/4Kxnw84SZX

Second gauging of the day for @EnvAgencySW . River Fowey@ Restormel. Approx 39 cumecs. One of the Crown Jewels of Devon and Cornwall gauges- there is a major abstraction supplying most of Cornwall‚Äôs drinking water, plus it lies upstream of Lostwithiel, so is key for #floodwarning https://t.co/fAH8040xcQ

tweets.text: Plenty of rain around impacting on the rivers Severn, Teme and Wye. Flood Barriers are being deployed at Shrewsbury, Bewdley and Hereford and we‚Äôre ensuring our assets are all clear and tiptop. Teams in place for the next 5 days 24/7 to #respond, #warn & #inform. https://t.co/mBnget4Q7B
